body:
I've been investigating compiling bitcoin core using C++20. It appears that our usage of boost requires boost 1.73 or above in order to compile using C++20. At this point, this is chasing concept ACKs. Upgrading to boost 1.73 in my understanding shouldn't be able to introduce any issues. 

https://www.boost.org/users/history/version_1_73_0.html
Boost 1.73 was released on April 28th, 2020 03:57 GMT and from my view is mature enough for the project to use. 

Once this (and potentially other fixes are /) is done, I may introduce a --enable-c++20 configure option similar to the --enable-c++17 flag that used to exist.
